trans-unit.source: Get started with Application Insights with Java in Eclipse
trans-unit.target: Get started with Application Insights with Java in Eclipse

trans-unit.source: Use the Eclipse plug-in to add performance and usage monitoring to your Java website with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Use the Eclipse plug-in to add performance and usage monitoring to your Java website with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Get started with Application Insights with Java in Eclipse
trans-unit.target: Get started with Application Insights with Java in Eclipse

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights SDK sends telemetry from your Java web application so that you can analyze usage and performance.
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights SDK sends telemetry from your Java web application so that you can analyze usage and performance.

trans-unit.source: The Eclipse plug-in for Application Insights automatically installs the SDK in your project so that you get out of the box telemetry, plus an API that you can use to write custom telemetry.
trans-unit.target: The Eclipse plug-in for Application Insights automatically installs the SDK in your project so that you get out of the box telemetry, plus an API that you can use to write custom telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Currently the plug-in works for Dynamic Web Projects in Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: Currently the plug-in works for Dynamic Web Projects in Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: ([Add Application Insights to other types of Java project][java].)
trans-unit.target: ([Add Application Insights to other types of Java project][java].)

trans-unit.source: You'll need:
trans-unit.target: You'll need:

trans-unit.source: Oracle JRE 1.6 or later
trans-unit.target: Oracle JRE 1.6 or later

trans-unit.source: A subscription to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/).
trans-unit.target: A subscription to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.microsoft.com/).

trans-unit.source: (You could start with the [free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).)
trans-unit.target: (You could start with the [free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).)

trans-unit.source: [Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers](http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/), Indigo or later.
trans-unit.target: [Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers](http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/), Indigo or later.

trans-unit.source: Windows 7 or later, or Windows Server 2008 or later
trans-unit.target: Windows 7 or later, or Windows Server 2008 or later

trans-unit.source: Install the SDK on Eclipse (one time)
trans-unit.target: Install the SDK on Eclipse (one time)

trans-unit.source: You only have to do this one time per machine.
trans-unit.target: You only have to do this one time per machine.

trans-unit.source: This step installs a toolkit which can then add the SDK to each Dynamic Web Project.
trans-unit.target: This step installs a toolkit which can then add the SDK to each Dynamic Web Project.

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, click Help, Install New Software.
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, click Help, Install New Software.

trans-unit.source: Help, Install New Software
trans-unit.target: Help, Install New Software

trans-unit.source: The SDK is in http://dl.windowsazure.com/eclipse, under Azure Toolkit.
trans-unit.target: The SDK is in http://dl.windowsazure.com/eclipse, under Azure Toolkit.

trans-unit.source: Uncheck **Contact all update sites...**
trans-unit.target: Uncheck **Contact all update sites...**

trans-unit.source: For Application Insights SDK, clear Contact all update sites
trans-unit.target: For Application Insights SDK, clear Contact all update sites

trans-unit.source: Follow the remaining steps for each Java project.
trans-unit.target: Follow the remaining steps for each Java project.

trans-unit.source: Get an Application Insights instrumentation key
trans-unit.target: Get an Application Insights instrumentation key

trans-unit.source: Your usage and performance analytics will be displayed in an Azure resource in the Azure web portal.
trans-unit.target: Your usage and performance analytics will be displayed in an Azure resource in the Azure web portal.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you set up an Azure resource for your application.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you set up an Azure resource for your application.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Microsoft Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Microsoft Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: (You'll need an [Azure subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/).)
trans-unit.target: (You'll need an [Azure subscription](http://azure.microsoft.com/).)

trans-unit.source: Create a new Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create a new Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: Click + and choose Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Click + and choose Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Set the application type to Java web application.
trans-unit.target: Set the application type to Java web application.

trans-unit.source: Fill a name, choose Java web app, and click Create
trans-unit.target: Fill a name, choose Java web app, and click Create

trans-unit.source: Find the instrumentation key of the new resource.
trans-unit.target: Find the instrumentation key of the new resource.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to paste this into your project in Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to paste this into your project in Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key
trans-unit.target: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key

trans-unit.source: Add the SDK to your Java project
trans-unit.target: Add the SDK to your Java project

trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights from the context menu of your web project.
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights from the context menu of your web project.

trans-unit.source: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key
trans-unit.target: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key

trans-unit.source: Paste the instrumentation key that you got from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Paste the instrumentation key that you got from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key
trans-unit.target: In the new resource overview, click Properties and copy the Instrumentation Key

trans-unit.source: The key is sent along with every item of telemetry and tells Application Insights to display it in your resource.
trans-unit.target: The key is sent along with every item of telemetry and tells Application Insights to display it in your resource.

trans-unit.source: Run the application and see metrics
trans-unit.target: Run the application and see metrics

trans-unit.source: Run your application.
trans-unit.target: Run your application.

trans-unit.source: Return to your Application Insights resource in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Return to your Application Insights resource in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: HTTP requests data will appear on the overview blade.
trans-unit.target: HTTP requests data will appear on the overview blade.

trans-unit.source: (If it isn't there, wait a few seconds and then click Refresh.)
trans-unit.target: (If it isn't there, wait a few seconds and then click Refresh.)

trans-unit.source: Server response, request counts, and failures
trans-unit.target: Server response, request counts, and failures

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detailed metrics.

trans-unit.source: Request counts by name
trans-unit.target: Request counts by name

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about metrics.][metrics]
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about metrics.][metrics]

trans-unit.source: And when viewing the properties of a request, you can see the telemetry events associated with it such as requests and exceptions.
trans-unit.target: And when viewing the properties of a request, you can see the telemetry events associated with it such as requests and exceptions.

trans-unit.source: All traces for this request
trans-unit.target: All traces for this request

trans-unit.source: Client-side telemetry
trans-unit.target: Client-side telemetry

trans-unit.source: From the QuickStart blade, click Get code to monitor my web pages:
trans-unit.target: From the QuickStart blade, click Get code to monitor my web pages:

trans-unit.source: On your app overview blade, choose Quick Start, Get code to monitor my web pages.
trans-unit.target: On your app overview blade, choose Quick Start, Get code to monitor my web pages.

trans-unit.source: Copy the script.
trans-unit.target: Copy the script.

trans-unit.source: Insert the code snippet in the head of your HTML files.
trans-unit.target: Insert the code snippet in the head of your HTML files.

trans-unit.source: View client-side data
trans-unit.target: View client-side data

trans-unit.source: Open your updated web pages and use them.
trans-unit.target: Open your updated web pages and use them.

trans-unit.source: Wait a minute or two, then return to Application Insights and refresh the usage blade.
trans-unit.target: Wait a minute or two, then return to Application Insights and refresh the usage blade.

trans-unit.source: Page view, user, and session metrics will appear on the usage blade:
trans-unit.target: Page view, user, and session metrics will appear on the usage blade:

trans-unit.source: Sessions, users and page views
trans-unit.target: Sessions, users and page views

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about setting up client-side telemetry.][usage]
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about setting up client-side telemetry.][usage]

trans-unit.source: Availability web tests
trans-unit.target: Availability web tests

trans-unit.source: Application Insights can test your website at regular intervals to check that it's up and responding well.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights can test your website at regular intervals to check that it's up and responding well.

trans-unit.source: To set up, click through the empty web tests chart on the overview blade, and provide your public URL.
trans-unit.target: To set up, click through the empty web tests chart on the overview blade, and provide your public URL.

trans-unit.source: You'll get charts of response times, plus email notifications if your site goes down.
trans-unit.target: You'll get charts of response times, plus email notifications if your site goes down.

trans-unit.source: Web test example
trans-unit.target: Web test example

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about availability web tests.][availability]
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about availability web tests.][availability]

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic logs
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic logs

trans-unit.source: If you're using Logback or Log4J (v1.2 or v2.0) for tracing, you can have your trace logs sent automatically to Application Insights where you can explore and search on them.
trans-unit.target: If you're using Logback or Log4J (v1.2 or v2.0) for tracing, you can have your trace logs sent automatically to Application Insights where you can explore and search on them.

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about diagnostic logs][javalogs]
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about diagnostic logs][javalogs]

trans-unit.source: Custom telemetry
trans-unit.target: Custom telemetry

trans-unit.source: Insert a few lines of code in your Java web application to find out what users are doing with it or to help diagnose problems.
trans-unit.target: Insert a few lines of code in your Java web application to find out what users are doing with it or to help diagnose problems.

trans-unit.source: You can insert code both in web page JavaScript and in the server-side Java.
trans-unit.target: You can insert code both in web page JavaScript and in the server-side Java.

trans-unit.source: [Learn about custom telemetry][track]
trans-unit.target: [Learn about custom telemetry][track]

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Detect and diagnose issues
trans-unit.target: Detect and diagnose issues

trans-unit.source: [Add web client telemetry][usage] to get performance telemetry from the web client.
trans-unit.target: [Add web client telemetry][usage] to get performance telemetry from the web client.

trans-unit.source: [Set up web tests][availability] to make sure your application stays live and responsive.
trans-unit.target: [Set up web tests][availability] to make sure your application stays live and responsive.

trans-unit.source: [Search events and logs][diagnostic] to help diagnose problems.
trans-unit.target: [Search events and logs][diagnostic] to help diagnose problems.

trans-unit.source: [Capture Log4J or Logback traces][javalogs]
trans-unit.target: [Capture Log4J or Logback traces][javalogs]

trans-unit.source: Track usage
trans-unit.target: Track usage

trans-unit.source: [Add web client telemetry][usage] to monitor page views and basic user metrics.
trans-unit.target: [Add web client telemetry][usage] to monitor page views and basic user metrics.

trans-unit.source: [Track custom events and metrics][track] to learn about how your application is used, both at the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: [Track custom events and metrics][track] to learn about how your application is used, both at the client and the server.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
